Posts.Content: Hi there I too am finding buying a bra for large boobs nearly impossible! I have had lumpectomy and sentinel nodes removed November 16.My size was before op 38gg,I couldn't get any sort of cami top or soft bra to fit other than the sports bra I already had. It is a shock absorber full support with standard bra fitting at the back and another further up. I couldn't fasten top one after op but can now.HOwever I then had to have right side mastectomy in the December as tumour was 10cm. All the mastectomy bras I could find didn't have 38gg size! I bought a Freya black under wired sport bra,was actually in the sale.WAs going to take out the underwire on my flat side but it was very comfy and gave me support under the arm etc.I go for my prosthetic fitting on Monday and start radiotherapy 15sessions on Valentine's Day and still on the hunt for proper bras.GOod luck in your quest and I will keep reading for advice too.THe softer can be pinned in but my new one will probably fall out!hey ho lol you got to laugh  big hugs Marie x
Posts.Title: Mastectomy bras for big boob

Posts.Content: Hi Louby 123,i started on tamoxifen in feb this year, I had read on here to stick to the same brand,but when I received my third box of tablets the brand had changed,so I just thought I would take them and see how I go.Big mistake! my first and second packet were made by TEVA,i felt a little nauseaus when I first took them and hot legs(had hot legs before though).But then I got used to it,the third box my daughter picked up for me as I was by then having my radiotherapy sessions and shes 21 and didn't think to check the box.I was too stressed  to go back to docs etc and started taking them, I felt really sick and then on the second week mid way through radiotherapy I was vomiting.They took me off all medication so I could continue radiotherapy.I was told to take to pharmasists and ask to change it,he wouldn't ,had to be from the doctor ,who then tells me they cannot put the brand on prescription.So fingers crossed I get TEVA this week or I wont be happy. Hope this helps you Happy Easter for Marie x

Posts.Title: Tamoxifen advice

Posts.Content: Hi I had both seroma and heamatoma,my bcnurses were brilliant.i had to go to the hospital and see breast cancer nurses only.They used a needle and drained usually 200 Mlls of fluid off.At first was twice a week and eventually slowed down.Unfortunately the tumour was too big so had to have right side mastectomy,again had seroma,even though hardly any tissue left but had to be all gone before I could have radiotherapy.Which took ten weeks hope this helps good luck Marie x

Posts.Title: Got bras you aren't wearing any more?

Posts.Content: Hi nanna nap I too had a grade 3 aggressive lobular cancer in october2016,I had lumpectomy and sentinel node removed.However,the tumour was 10cm and so on 21st Dec 2016 I had right side mastectomy.we had to wait nearly 4 weeks to hear the results from the onchar test,which was very worrying and I did cry quite a few tears over xmas.I resigned myself that I would lose my hair and have chemo.BUT the test came back with a score of 8! I did have all the breast tissue removed on the right side so flat as a pancake on one side and still a whopper on the other lol.so don't despair,I am on tamoxifen and its 3 weeks since I had 15 sessions of radiotherapy.I think if my score was higher and I was advised to have the chemo I would.Good luck to you and hope my story helps xx

Posts.Title: Breast pain after taking zolodex?

Posts.Content: Hi all, can anyone advise me please? I am currently recovering from grade 3 lobular cancer,lumpectomy,mastectomy and 15 radiotherapy sessions. I am now on zolodex injections too,after 3.5 months of injections I found a lump in remaining boob,had it checked out and doesn't show up on mammogram or scan.My dilemma is the cancer on right breast didn't either,but doc did biopsy.This time he said he can't just biopsy as he thinks it's fatty tissue.It is now painful and also under my arm.I can't help thinking its come back, but if I know for sure its a side effect of zolodex it will put my mind at rest thanks from Marie.
